body: one more bug for the list "bugs that were not detected since only one parameter setting per estimator was tested". Working on upgrading the forecasting tests to avoid this in the future.

issue.title: [ENH] test framework: test class for forecasting module

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
See here for overview of recent test framework related PRs:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2053

---

This PR refactors the `test_all_forecasters` module to the new test class based design in #1987.
This PR requires and is conditional on #1987, all changes to `test_all_estimators` should be reviewed in #1987.

Besides the refactor, the conditional fixture generation plug-in is used to remove the dozen times repeated boilerplate code to obtain the `n_columns` variable, this is now a conditional fixture instead.

No further refactoring is carried out, although there would be some opportunity based on this (e.g., using scenarios or moving to `test_all_estimators`). Ideas for further refactoring along natural lines are left in the code as todo comments.

Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look

-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs

-->

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

<!-- This section is particularly useful if you have a pull request that is still in development. You can guide the reviews to focus on the parts that are ready for their comments. We suggest using bullets (indicated by * or -) and filled checkboxes [x] here -->

Please be aware that we are a loose team of volunteers so patience is necessary; assistance handling other issues is very welcome. We value all user contributions, no matter how minor they are. In either case, we ask for your understanding during the review process.
-->

#### PR checklist

Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [ ] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [ ] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

##### For new estimators
- [x] I've added the estimator to the online documentation.
- [ ] I've updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my estimator works.


<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->

body:
In-sample for Naive should be the equivalent of a one-step forecasting horizon, no matter what the out of sample horizon is,  right? 
i.e. *Yt = Yt-1* or *Yt = Yt-m* for seasonal.
yes, for the "last" strategy. Similar for the other strategies.

issue.title: [BUG] naive forecaster window error

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#### Reference Issues/PRs
Fixes #1990.

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
Increases padding width in the case that `last_window` wasn't the full window length. This occurs when the forecasting horizon starts in sample, as the window length is the full length of the data but there is not enough historical data to fill the window so I have added NA's in this case. There is precedent for this as NAs are added to satisfy a window length in the case that the window length isn't a multiple of `sp`. 

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?
Does this fix work theoretically. I am not sure if this breaks the functionality of the Naive forecaster.
